extractions.description: This research paper introduces the Biomedical Alert News Dataset (BAND), which includes annotated samples from news articles, emails, and alerts related to disease outbreaks. The dataset is designed to enhance epidemiological analysis and includes benchmark NLP tasks.

type.justification: The paper presents a new dataset, BAND, and performs experiments to evaluate the performance of existing models on various NLP tasks.
type.quote: we introduce the Biomedical Alert News Dataset (BAND)1 , which includes 1,508 samples from existing reported news articles, open emails, and alerts, as well as 30 epidemiology-related questions.

name.justification: The main focus is on NLP tasks such as Named Entity Recognition, Question Answering, and Event Extraction within the epidemiology domain.
name.quote: The BAND dataset brings new challenges to the NLP world, requiring better disguise capability of the content and the ability to infer important information.

name.justification: One of the benchmark tasks performed on the BAND dataset is Named Entity Recognition (NER).
name.quote: We provide several benchmark tasks, including Named Entity Recognition (NER)

name.justification: Another benchmark task performed on the BAND dataset is Question Answering (QA).
name.quote: We provide several benchmark tasks, including Named Entity Recognition (NER), Question Answering (QA)

name.justification: Another benchmark task performed on the BAND dataset is Event Extraction (EE).
name.quote: We provide several benchmark tasks, including Named Entity Recognition (NER), Question Answering (QA), and Event Extraction (EE)

name.justification: The CRFBased model incorporates contextual information to recognize and classify named entities.
name.quote: CRFBased model...utilizes a Conditional Random Field (CRF) layer to predict the BIO tags for each input word.

is_contributed.justification: The CRFBased model is not newly introduced in this paper but is used for benchmarking.
is_contributed.quote: CRFBased model (Lafferty et al., 2001; McCallum and Li, 2003; Manning et al., 2014)

is_executed.justification: There is no specific mention of execution on GPU or CPU for the CRFBased model.

is_compared.justification: The CRFBased model is compared with other models in the NER task.
is_compared.quote: We compare the performance of various models, including CRFBased, TokenBased, SpanBased, and ChatGPT models in extracting named entities.

referenced_paper_title.value: Conditional Random Fields: Probabilistic models for segmenting and labeling sequence data
referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference paper for the CRFBased model.
referenced_paper_title.quote: CRFBased model (Lafferty et al., 2001; McCallum and Li, 2003; Manning et al., 2014)

name.justification: The BAND dataset is the primary dataset introduced and used for experiments in the paper.
name.quote: we introduce the Biomedical Alert News Dataset (BAND)1 , which includes 1,508 samples from existing reported news articles, open emails, and alerts

referenced_paper_title.justification: The BAND dataset is newly introduced in this paper and has no prior reference.

name.justification: Label Studio is used to develop the annotation interface for the BAND dataset.
name.quote: we develop a new annotation interface using LabelStudio5

referenced_paper_title.justification: Label Studio is a tool used for annotation in this research and is not cited from another paper.
